output.conclusion: This course has provided a comprehensive overview of engineering drawing principles and techniques. By mastering these skills, you will be well-equipped to create and interpret technical drawings effectively.
output.introduction: Welcome to Engineering Drawing! This intermediate-level course builds upon foundational knowledge to enhance your skills in creating and interpreting technical drawings. We will explore advanced techniques and industry best practices.

chapters.description: A quick recap of lines, lettering, and basic geometric constructions. Reinforce understanding of fundamental drawing elements.
Revisit the principles of multi-view projection. Focus on creating accurate and clear representations of objects.
Learn about different types of section views and how to create them using cutting plane lines.
Understand the conventions for hatching different materials in section views. Ensure clarity and accuracy.
Introduction to auxiliary views and their purpose. Focus on creating primary auxiliary views to show true shapes.
Learn about secondary auxiliary views and how to create them for complex geometries.
Explore advanced dimensioning techniques, including chain dimensioning, baseline dimensioning, and coordinate dimensioning.
Understand the concepts of tolerances and fits and how to apply them in engineering drawings.
Learn about different types of bolts and screws and how to represent them in engineering drawings.
Understand the representation of rivets and welds in engineering drawings. Focus on standard symbols and conventions.
Learn how to create assembly drawings from individual part drawings. Focus on bill of materials and part identification.
Understand how to create exploded views to show the relationship between parts in an assembly.
